title: (x) Mastercard identity typeface - ITC Garamond {Patricia}
content:
As I’m not very well educated with my serif italics, does anyone know what typeface Mastercard uses for their identity?

[http://www.mastercard.com/us/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135613/http:/www.mastercard.com/us/index.html "http://www.mastercard.com/us/index.html")

 [‹ (x) Looking for very condensed sans serifs - various {Dav}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135613/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13261 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Looking for fonts with calligraphic ornaments - various {gang} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135613/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13271 "Go to next forum topic")
author: biddy

comments.content: It’s definitely a Garamond, but exactly which flavor I wouldn’t venture a guess.

[ITC Garamond Book Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-garamond/book-italic/testdrive.html?s=Lunch+for+a+Lifetime&p=48) based on the high x-height’
Well, that certainly looks close enough to me. Thank you both!
